text:

text: An increasing number of airlines are adding clauses that require passengers to settle disputes in private arbitration, rather than in court, and bar passengers from starting or joining class-action lawsuits. https://t.co/N4gvbVCcIK

text: Liverpool has waited 3 decades for an English title. Now it probably must wait only a few more days. https://t.co/8J7yAa6PYf

text: As China tries to stifle the new outbreak in its capital city, it is applying something often alien to the instincts of the country’s rulers: restraint. Beijing's leaders are not crushing the entire city with heavy-handed restrictions. https://t.co/WRRR5xeEAc

text: "During the pandemic, many people have been unable to make it to the bedside of their dying relatives. I was one of the lucky ones," writes @motokorich. https://t.co/MbDQqTVKXO

text: Bullfighting in Spain has faced declining popularity amid animal rights concerns. As the coronavirus halted fights, bull breeders and matadors accused the government of using the pandemic as an accelerator for bullfighting’s permanent removal. https://t.co/2bCW2WYmGx

text: Global markets drifted lower on Monday, amid persistent worries about the ability of global leaders to stop the coronavirus from spreading further https://t.co/0OL2WMtXOo

text: Social media giants like Facebook publicly support Black Lives Matter and its mission. But content on their platforms may be compromising the movement for racial justice. Listen to today's episode of "The Daily." https://t.co/PCk9XcEi72

text: Audrey Strauss has been a behind-the-scenes force in the U.S. attorney’s office in Manhattan as it pursued cases against people connected to President Trump. Now that Trump has fired her boss, she has been forced into the spotlight. https://t.co/1Fs6XAjzV8

name: nytimes
text:

Parscale was not present.

On the way home, the president was muted.

On Sunday, Parscale shrugged off rumors of his demise, claiming he has been fired 85 weeks in a row.

text: Joe Biden is deep into his search for a running mate and is aiming to announce his choice by Aug. 1. Here are 12 women who are under serious consideration, and why each might be chosen — and might not be. https://t.co/wL1Ysnm5lW

text: Nascar said it had opened an investigation after a noose was found in Bubba Wallace's garage stall at Talladega Superspeedway. “We are angry and outraged, and cannot state strongly enough how seriously we take this heinous act,” Nascar said. https://t.co/IgStqYPXUO

name: nytimes
text:
Sridhar Ramaswamy built Google's advertising business into a $115 billion behemoth. Now disillusioned, he is taking aim at his old employer by with a search startup that will rely on subscription fees, not ads, to pay for its services.
https://t.co/qB1cDuOaLL
